name: nickel mine operation and benefication to nickel concentrate, 16% Ni | nickel concentrate, 16% Ni | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/13679/documentation

This dataset represents the production of 1 kg of nickel ore, beneficiated to 16% Ni in Quebec (Canada) for the year 2010. ;This dataset is a disagreggation of the existing dataset ''nickel mine operation, sulfidic ore'', which contains smelting and refining on top of the mine operation. The disagreggation was done  because primary data was available for nickel mine operation but not for subsequent stages of smelting and refining. Thus, the production volume of this dataset is already included in the global dataset ''nickel mine operation, sulfidic ore, GLO''. Until data on smelting and refining become available, this dataset cannot be used as part of a life cycle assessment.;The concentrate produced is composed of 16% Ni; 4% Cu; 0.24% Co; 0.61 g/t Au; 10.84 g/t Ag; 2.8 g/t Pt; 9.68 g/t Pd; 0.95 g/t Rh.;The sulfidic nickel ore is extracted in an underground mine, where 7.21 kg of ore are extracted per kg of concentrate produced. The recovery rate (metal in ore/metal in the concentrate) is 90% for Ni and 82% for Cu. ;The  concentrate produced is sent to a smelter located in Ontario (Canada) and to a refinery located in Norway (both excluded).;No specific data were available except for some emissions to water and air publicly available. Most of the data were taken from the Environmental Impact Assessment of the only Nickel mine in Quebec dated from 1993 and converted with a conversion factor (ore mined in 2010/expected amount of ore according to ElA). Some extrapolations were made based on ecoinvent datasets.

Mining process starting from nickel ore, in ground.

This activity ends at the gate of the beneficiation plant.
The dataset includes the extraction of nickel ore in an underground mine and it's benefication, management of tailings and waste rocks and wastewater treatment. 
The dataset does not include the end of life of the wasterwater sludge (no information available).
category: C:Manufacturing/24:Manufacture of basic metals/242:Manufacture of basic precious and other non-ferrous metals/2420:Manufacture of basic precious and other non-ferrous metals

processDocumentation.timeDescription: The dataset represent the activity in 2010. Uncertainty has been adjusted accordingly.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: This module represents the production of nickel concentrate in the Québec region.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Mining is done underground, followed by beneficiation. Overburden (2.67 kg/kg concentrate) and tailings (6.99 kg/kg concentrate) are disposed on the mining site.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription:
Extrapolations were done for the following inputs:  
- ANFO (explosive and diesel): based on dataset ''iron mine operation and iron ore benefication to 65%, Québec 2011''.
- Sand and cement: based on dataset ''nickel mine operation, sulfidic ore, GLO''.
- Infrastructure (including landuse) : based on dataset ''nickel mine operation, sulfidic ore, GLO''
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Estimations (Environmental Impact Assessment), specific data (National Pollutant Release Inventory (NPRI)) and extrapolation based on ecoinvent datasets.

exchanges.description: Calculated Value : nickel produced (measurement) divided by the share of nickel in concentrate (estimation taken from the Environmental Impact Assessment).

flow.name: nickel concentrate, 16% Ni
flow.category: C:Manufacturing/24:Manufacture of basic metals/242:Manufacture of basic precious and other non-ferrous metals/2420:Manufacture of basic precious and other non-ferrous metals

exchanges.description:
Measured Value. National Pollutant Release Inventory (NPRI), 2010. This is Canada's legislated, publicly accessible inventory of pollutant releases (to air, water and land), disposals and transfers for recycling.
http://www.ec.gc.ca/inrp-npri/
In dataset ''sulfidic tailing, off-site'' only emissions via bottom leaching are considered. Hence, emissions to water contained in the final effluent are added.

Calculated value based on nickel, 99.5% dataset (ecoinvent v2).
ecoinvent v2 dataset:
extracted mineral: 110t
sand required: 45,6t
sand required per extracted mineral: 416kg/t

extracted mineral in Quebec mine:1279778 t
total required sand: 416*1279778=532387648kg

The exchange has been updated from 'ammonium nitrate, as N' into 'ammonium nitrate' and therefore its amount has been scaled (multiplied) from 0.002 kg by 2.8573 kg of 'ammonium nitrate' per kg of 'ammonium nitrate, as N'. Original comment of the exchange is: Estimation based on ''iron mine operation and iron ore benefication to 65% Fe, Québec 2011'' dataset (based on the extracted ore). 
Assumption : use of explosive Anfo.

exchanges.description:
Calculated Value based on the Environmental Impact Assessment and a conversion factor (ore mined in 2010/expected amount of ore according to ElA).  
The sulfidic tailings, off-site dataset is used as a proxy, composition of leachage to water may not fully correspond. For the modelled mine, sulfidic tailings remain on site. The landuse in the tailing dataset is much smaller than the one of the modelled mine. Landuse is hence directly added in this mine operation dataset.

flow.name: Dinitrogen monoxide
flow.category: Elementary flows/Emission to air/low population density

exchanges.description:
Calculated Values based on the Environmental Impact Assessment and a conversion factor (ore mined in 2010/expected amount of ore according to ElA).
Reported as anti-freeze. 
Raw data gives the amount of anti-freeze. It was assume a 60% ethylene glycol solution (% by volume), as its freezing point is -55 C (dilution water is neglected as it is marginal compared to the global amount of water consumed on site) (source :  http://www.engineeringtoolbox.com/ethylene-glycol-d_146.html).
